sub_title: Professor Emeritus of Law at University of Amsterdam
summary:
Professor Emeritus of the Law of the Economic and Monetary Union (EMU), University of Amsterdam, consultant on EMU law & EU banking regulation, Member of the Administrative Board of Review of the ECB and assessor at the Belgian Competition Authority (BCA).

I have worked for the central bank and the competition authority of the Netherlands. I worked for De Nederlandsche Bank N.V. (the Dutch central bank) in Amsterdam for 24 years where I was general counsel (1989-2001). In this position, I was responsible for legal advice, with a focus on EU banking directives, the IMF and the preparations for monetary union (the introduction of the single currency). I also was a member of the Legal Committee of the European System of Central Banks.

From late 2001 until early 2014, I worked at the Netherlands Competition Authority (Nederlandse Mededingingautoriteit, or NMa) in The Hague, first as director of the authority’s legal department (2001-2004), then as Chief Legal Counsel (2004-2013), giving legal advice to the NMa’s Board and its departments and, finally, as strategic legal counsel at the Authority Consumers & Markets (ACM), the successor to NMa (2013-2014).

Member of the Committee on International Monetary Law of the International Law Association (MOCOMILA). Expert at P.R.I.M.E., the international organisation for dispute resolution and expert advice in the financial sector.

Specialties: law of the Economic and Monetary Union (euro and ECB, economic governance of the Euro Area), EU regulation of the banking industry, central banking issues, competition law, including (harmonisation of) fining guidelines and private enforcement of competition law, and the law of 'targeted sanctions' (financial freezes), sustainable finance. Interested in Islamic finance, climate change and biodiversity loss, interreligious dialogue and animal rights.

projects.title: A manifest for Europe
projects.description: A website devoted to the story of Europe, and of European integration. In times of crises, and when faced with major challenges, it is important to remember what we have in common. And why we pursue a path of integration between the peoples and economies of Europe. The site provides readers with an essay setting out my vision of the current challenges and providing inspiration on the European project.

projects.title: ADEMU/PWC Lecture: Sustainable Economic and Monetary Union in Europe in turbulent times
projects.description:
Starting from a legal-institutional perspective, the lecture sketches the major challenges for researchers and policymakers alike in the areas of economic governance, monetary union and banking union with a view to the sustainability of Europe's Economic and Monetary Union. Multidisciplinary approaches are called for. Policies and research should be embedded in a wider societal perspective, with accountability, effects 'on the ground' and the humaneness of policies core considerations.
Time: 10 October - 17:00 to 19:00 CEST
Venue: Conference Room, Villa la Fonte

projects.title: Islamic finance and the influence of religion on the law
projects.description: The proceedings of a seminar on Islamic finance and the influence of religion on the law, held during the 74th biennial conference of the International Law Association, in The Hague in August 2010, is published by Eleven international publishing. As the editor, Prof. Smits brings together the presentations of the panellists and a contribution on whether Shari’a compliant finance would have diminished the impact of the financial crisis, and whether Islamic finance could thus contribute to a more balanced and sustainable economic system. The book also contains the Surahs from the Qu’ran on the prohibition of riba (interest) and the verses of the Tanach (Hebrew Bible) on the prohibition of interest and the Jubilee year.

projects.title: Euro T-Bills Fund Proposal (ELEC)
projects.description: On 28 November 2011, a panel of experts to which I belong published a proposal for the temporary issue of short-term debt instruments by Member States of the euro area. This proposed first step towards the definitive pooling of access to financial markets by the euro area governments combines incentives for fiscal discipline with a mechanism of solidarity. The group submitted a further amended proposal as a response to the  public consultation on the issue of EMU 'Stability bonds' which the European Commission opened on 23 November 2011. For the text of the proposal of 27 January 2012, the press release and the legal chapter on the issue of eurobonds of 4 November 2011, please visit the website of the European League for Economic Cooperation (ELEC; http://www.elec-lece.eu/) and of Graham Bisshop (http://www.grahambishop.com/).

courses.name: Legal Risks and Good Governance for Central Banks

profile_positions.description: Legal and strategic advice on the law of the Economic and Monetary Union (EMU) in the European Union, on legal and strategic aspects of monetary unions, on European and African regulation of the banking industry, on EU financial freezes ('targeted' or 'smart sanctions') and on sustainable finance; teaching about these issues, chairing seminars, and giving strategic advice and counselling.
profile_positions.title: Director and Owner

profile_positions.description: As part-time professor, I taught the Law of Economic and Monetary Union, i.e. free movement of capital and freedom to effect payments within in the EU and with third countries, economic policy coordination arrangements, including the Excessive Deficit Procedure and the Stability & Growth Pact, the European Central Bank's legal foundations, the public and private law of the euro and the international relations of Europe in the field of monetary and exchange rate policy. Since the beginning of the Master Law & Finance, I teach institutional aspects of monetary policy and banking supervision, i.e. the independence and the (political and judicial) accountability of the European Central Bank under its dual mandates of maintaining price stability and contributing to financial stability (the safety and soundness of credit institutions) in the Euro Area. The role of central banks and supervisors in combating climate change and in contributing to sustainable finance are another central theme in my course.

profile_positions.description: Besides responsibility for legal advice on in-house corporate affairs, my work entailed a special focus on central-bank related subjects, such as European Community (Union) banking directives, the International Monetary Fund, and preparations for Economic and Monetary Union (EMU) and the introduction of the euro, both at EU level and domestically. Formulating the legal framework for the ESCB was prime among these tasks. I also worked on the development and application of sanction regimes against third countries and entities.
